When I include the org.eclipse.swt project into a project that uses the Java Communications API, the application no longer works and gives the error:

java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no Serial in java.library.paththrown while loading javax.comm.RXTXCommDriver
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no Serial in java.library.path
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1682)
	at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:822)
	at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:992)
	at javax.comm.CommPortIdentifier.<clinit>(CommPortIdentifier.java:83)

Without the org.eclipse.swt project included, the application runs correctly and finds the serial port.  The build path must not be working correctly, because nothing from the SWT API has been imported into the program yet.  comm.jar is located in /Library/Java/Extensions/ under Mac OS X.
Looks like someone is hammering the java.library.path to find SWT, causing it to no longer find the JNI code needed to run javax.comm.
